summary: This is an email chain from August 12, 2019, showing supportive communication between two federal prison officials, an Associate Warden at MCC New York and a Licensed Clinical Social Worker at FCI Butner, North Carolina. The subject 'Stay Strong Soror' and content suggest it is a personal message of encouragement, possibly related to the stress of the high-profile Jeffrey Epstein case, as Epstein was an inmate at MCC New York at the time.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York
persons.context: The sender/recipient of an email offering and receiving words of encouragement and support, located at 150 Park Row, New York.

persons.name: LCSW, BCD United States Public Health Service Licensed Clinical Social Worker Complex Coordinator for the Reduction in Sentence Program (RIS)
persons.role: Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Complex Coordinator
persons.context: A federal prison staff member at FCI Butner, North Carolina, who reaches out with a message of support, stating 'God's got your back!' and offering to talk offline.

connections.person2: LCSW, BCD United States Public Health Service Licensed Clinical Social Worker Complex Coordinator for the Reduction in Sentence Program (RIS)
connections.description: Colleagues within the federal prison system exchanging supportive personal messages, referring to each other as 'friend', 'sister', and 'soror'.

events.title: Support Email Exchange Between Prison Officials
events.description: An email chain where a social worker from FCI Butner reaches out to an Associate Warden at MCC New York with a message of encouragement, saying 'Stay strong my sister. God's got your back!'
personsInvolved: LCSW, BCD United States Public Health Service Licensed Clinical Social Worker Complex Coordinator for the Reduction in Sentence Program (RIS)

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is a personal email dated August 12, 2019, between two federal Bureau of Prisons staff members.
The subject line 'Stay Strong Soror' and content suggest a supportive, personal relationship, possibly heightened due to circumstances at MCC New York.
The timing is significant as Jeffrey Epstein was an inmate at MCC New York and died there on August 10, 2019, just two days prior to this email.
The email correspondence shows staff offering personal support, which may indicate a stressful environment following Epstein's death.
The document provides insight into the professional network and interpersonal communications within the federal prison system during a critical period.
